data: May be performed by RNs at Urgent and Primary Care Centre
For practice guidelines, refer to Decision Support Tool (DST): NIA Emergency Contraceptive Pills (ECP)

Indication: 
levonorgestrel should be provided to any woman requesting emergency contraception
ECP is indicated for known or suspected unprotected or inadequately protected sex, which may include: 
- Sexual assault
- Failure to use a contraceptive method
-  Condom breakage, leakage, or slippage
- Missed or late hormonal contraceptives
- Late Depo-Provera re-injection
- Ejaculation on external genitalia
ECP is also indicated to have on hand in advance of unprotected or inadequately protected intercourse
1.5 mg, PO, once: drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
